panel-discussions.title: Panel Discussions
panel-discussions.description: FOSSter 2025's Panel Discussions are live, moderated conversations featuring thought leaders discussing pivotal topics in open source. Expect interactive dialogue, cross-disciplinary insights, and vibrant debate — a format that moves far beyond solo talks.

items.title: Gain Diverse Perspectives
items.content: Hear from multiple experts as they unpack complex FOSS topics from various angles.

items.title: Spark New Ideas
items.content: The live, interactive format fosters creative thinking and collaborative solutions.

items.title: Engage with Experts
items.content: Q&A segments provide direct interaction and learning opportunities with panelists.

items.title: Stay Ahead of Trends
items.content: Panels cover the most relevant, emerging themes in open source and tech.

sections.title: Themes & Focus Areas
items: The Future of Open Source Governance & Sustainability
Building Inclusive Communities: Diversity, Equity & Belonging in FOSS
Emerging Technologies & Open Source's Role (AI, Web3, Cloud Native, etc.)

sections.title: Panel Sponsorship Opportunities
items: Prominent Branding: Showcased during the session for high visibility.
Thought Leadership: Align your brand with forward-thinking FOSS topics.
Direct Participation: Eligible sponsor reps may join panels.
High Engagement: Panels draw peak interest — great exposure guaranteed.

panel-discussions.schedule: Dates, times, and themes will be included in the official agenda.

job-fair.title: Job Fair
job-fair.description: The Recruitment Zone at FOSSter 2025 is a hub where tech companies and FOSS enthusiasts meet. Held during peak networking hours, it offers rich face-to-face connections and career-changing opportunities for all.

sections.title: What You Get
items: Meet Top Companies: Connect with companies actively hiring open-source talent across industries.
Explore Career Paths: Discover roles and internships aligned with your passion for FOSS.
Showcase Your Skills: Stand out with your GitHub, FOSS projects, and community contributions.
Expand Your Network: Meet recruiters and professionals from across the open-source world.

sections.title: For Companies
items: Access Targeted Talent: Reach a qualified, open-source-focused audience of developers and contributors.
Showcase Your Brand: Highlight your FOSS initiatives, work culture, and opportunities.
Boost Employer Visibility: Engage during peak networking hours and enhance your reputation in the FOSS ecosystem.

job-fair.schedule: Job Fair timings will be shared in the agenda.

open-source-101.title: Open Source 101
open-source-101.description: Understand what open source is, why it matters, and how to be a part of it — no experience needed.
open-source-101.ledBy: AmFOSS — India's largest student-run tech club

items.title: Demystify Open Source
items.content: Understand what open source is, why it matters, and how to be a part of it — no experience needed.

items.title: Master Essential Tools
items.content: Learn Git and GitHub through step-by-step, hands-on guidance with version control and collaboration workflows.

items.title: Make Your First Contribution
items.content: Find beginner-friendly projects, understand contribution flow, and submit your first Pull Request.

items.title: Join the Community
items.content: Explore open-source etiquette and best practices for engaging with global developer communities.

sections.title: Learning Outcomes
items: Core open-source concepts, licenses, and philosophy
Intro to Git: version control, branching, committing, and merging
GitHub basics: repositories, issues, pull requests, and workflows
Finding beginner-friendly projects to contribute to
Community etiquette and best practices

sections.title: Who Should Attend
items: Students from any discipline
Newcomers to programming or tech
Curious minds exploring open source
Anyone ready to make their first FOSS contribution

open-source-101.schedule: Timings and registration details will be announced in the official agenda.

speaker-sessions.title: Speaker Sessions
speaker-sessions.description: Absorb insights directly from seasoned professionals and core maintainers of key open-source projects.
speaker-sessions.proposalCall: We're now accepting proposals for 1-hour sessions. Submit your title, abstract, and bio.

items.title: Learn from the Best
items.content: Absorb insights directly from seasoned professionals and core maintainers of key open-source projects.

items.title: Deep Dive into Topics
items.content: Each session offers a focused, hour-long exploration of technical and community-driven challenges.

items.title: Ignite Inspiration
items.content: Hear the stories of innovators making an impact and walk away motivated to build your own path.

items.title: Broaden Your Perspective
items.content: Understand community dynamics, collaboration strategies, and the broader impact of open-source development.

speaker-sessions.schedule: Timing details and dedicated tracks will be part of the official agenda.

workshops.title: Workshops
workshops.description: Gain real-world experience with open-source tools through hands-on exercises led by experts.

items.title: Practical Skill Building
items.content: Gain real-world experience with open-source tools through hands-on exercises led by experts.

items.title: Expert Guidance
items.content: Get personalized support and best practices from seasoned instructors throughout the sessions.

items.title: Deep Dives
items.content: Focus on specific technologies with time to explore advanced techniques and real-world use cases.

items.title: Expand Your Toolset
items.content: Broaden your knowledge in open-source ecosystems like Docker, Kubernetes, Git, and beyond.

items.value: 2 per day (Day 1: A & B, Day 2: C & D)

sections.title: Featured Technologies & Topics
items: Git & Advanced Version Control
Docker & Containerization
Kubernetes Orchestration
Python / JavaScript Frameworks
Open-Source Data Management Tools

workshops.schedule: Final schedule will be published in the official agenda.
